Reviews.Content: Loved it but customer service can be improved on Lovely hotel. Accomodation is great (rooms are deceit)but location is a bit odd. Next to a big shopping mall. Nearest metro station is Barbera Del Valles for you to get to the centre of Barcelona(Price 2.70 euros each way). You can catch a bus(number 1) from the bus stop by the mall for 70cent to the station and it drops you by the doorsteps of the metro station(you don't have to use a taxi everytime if you are on a budget) Customer service could be improved on. Overall good value for money.
Reviews.Author: turbotee23574

Reviews.Content: Hotel for the New Year's Day       My room. Big and clean
Reviews.Author: frank77turin

Reviews.Content: good value Luckily we had a car so it was very easy to get in and out of Barcelona from the hotel. I would not recommend this hotel if you dont have a car. It was located next door to a shopping centre which had cheaper eating options. Rooms were modern and clean, pretty much standard 4 star stuff.
Reviews.Author: Elvis2006

Reviews.Content: Excellent value, very hard to find We stayed at thishotel more than 3 years ago and at that time it was newly opened. I agree with the other reviewers - location is very challenging to find especially if you are a first-timer in Barcelona, and it is a good 20-30 min ride back to Barcelona (if you dont get lost), but other than that I was completely satisfied with what this 3* hotel had to offer for $70-80 per night. The room is furnished business style which measures with the best 4 star business hotels, breakfast was good and service was good. I really have no other complaints besides how difficult it is to find. But on the other hand, for people on budget - parking is free (unlike the centre of Barcelona), and the hotel is cheap and good, so once you learn your way back into Barcelona, there really should be no complaints. I personally much rather stay in a newer hotel 20min away than in a dated hotel in the middle of the city (new hotels in Barcelona are not common).
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian_travels

Reviews.Content: Business Users Only       The sink!
Reviews.Author: WittleWooz

Reviews.Content: Probably not worth it
Reviews.Author: Bbpink

Reviews.Content: In the middle of no-where ImportantIf you are travelling by public transport, then I would think again about staying in this hotel. It is in the middle of no-whereFrom the Airport (El Prat) get the Airbus (this is the quickest and most comfortable way of travelling. It stops directly outside airport doors. (It costs 3.60 Euros single) You need to travel to Pl Catalunya which will take you approximately 30 minutesEl Prat to Pl Espanya 鈥?15 minutes Pl Espanya to Urell - 5 minutes Urell to Universitat 鈥?5 minutesUniversitat to Pl Catalunya 鈥?5 minutes The train is a little cheaper, but you have to change train a few times.From Pl Catalunya you will need to get the train to Barbera Del Valles (Barbera del Valles) It might not appear on all of the metro maps - if you are looking for the train station on the map it is in the north east. The nearest metro stop is (Sabadell-Rambla -green line) this will cost 1 Euro and took 30 minutes.Then you will need to call for a taxi as you will be heading onto the motorway (costs between 5 鈥?6 Euros) 5 minutesThe hotel is lovely 鈥?extremely clean. The hotel does provide lovely white bath sheets, TV (Spanish), they left a toothbrush  toothpaste, soap, shampoo, shower gel, razor  shaving cream, tissues and even a shoe cleaner. Breakfast is 12 Euros (we didn鈥檛 eat there, but it looked nice). The Baricentro shopping mall is around the back of the hotel, it took about 3 minutes to get there and it had about 80 shops including supermarkets, restaurants and bars. The hotel is in the middle of no-where so it would be beneficial to hire a car if you stay there, although parking in Barcelona鈥檚 city centre is very limited.Pl Caralunya is the main part 鈥?it鈥檚 like Trafalgar Square - LondonYou must travel around Barcelona by the Tourist Bus (Barcelona Bus Turistic) 鈥?it is an open top bus which takes you to all the main sites of Barcelona. A 1 day ticket costs 18 Euros for Adults  11 Euros for children. The great thing about the bus is the fact that you can get on and off the bus as many times as you like. The buses turn up about every 5 minutes. There are three routes that you can take and 42 different stops. The ticket will also get you into many of the attractions at a cheaper rate and it even has discounts on restaurants. It鈥檚 a good idea to get a two day bus pass which costs 21 Euros for an adult and13 Euros for children. If you have any questins just email me!
Reviews.Author: TaniaMacDonald
